com.soa.transport.http.deploy
Interface ResourceRegistration

All Known Implementing Classes:
DelegatingResourceRegistration, SimpleResourceRegistration
public interface ResourceRegistration

Instances of this interface can be published as OSGi services, which will result in any capable HTTP server registering the resources and publishing them. This is an SOA-specific registration interface, and will work with the SOA HTTP service either in a standalone deployment or inside a J2EE container.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getContext()
          Get the root context path for the resources
 java.lang.String getPathSpec()
          Get the path spec used to register the resources.
 java.lang.String getPrefix()
          Get the prefix, if any, that will be prepended to any resource requests for the context
 org.osgi.service.http.HttpContext getResources()
          The context used to retrieve the resources
 

Method Detail

getResources

org.osgi.service.http.HttpContext getResources()
The context used to retrieve the resources

Returns:
The context that can be used to authorize and retrieve the resources

getContext

java.lang.String getContext()
Get the root context path for the resources

Returns:
The root context for the resources. This is only used to associate the resources with the appropriate web application.

getPrefix

java.lang.String getPrefix()
Get the prefix, if any, that will be prepended to any resource requests for the context

Returns:
The prefix to use. This may be null. This corresponds to the "name" parameter used in the HttpService.registerReources() method.

getPathSpec

java.lang.String getPathSpec()
Get the path spec used to register the resources.

Returns:
The pathSpec used to access the resources. This is the same as a normal servlet pathSpec. If this is null, the resources will be registered with the web application, and will be available through the ServletContext's getResource methods but will not have an externally accessible path.
